Pros:

+ It‚Äôs free now. 
+ No battle.net required
+ Truly a one of a kind game; even 7 years later there is nothing quite like it. 

Cons:

- Genuinely the most garbage community I have ever had the displeasure of interacting with. When trying to learn a new hero in Quick Play, or just trying to chill with friends, entire teams will counterpick you and trash talk you constantly when you struggle. 
- Clueless devs in charge of game balance. They will gigabuff characters seemingly at random, make several minor, irrelevant tweaks to others, all while characters that desperately need adjustment are ignored for multiple seasons. 
- Despite the devs stating that this is not their intention, counterpicking is heavily rewarded over player skill. Many games are decided in the character select menu rather than on the battlefield. Expect frequent mirror matchups as a result, especially as you climb in rank, and for games to be held hostage by teammates who refuse to switch. 
- Once free content (skins, heroes, pve missions) is now either locked behind a paywall, or made incredibly tedious to unlock without paying. In the case of heroes, it hurts the competitive integrity of the game when each team does not have equal access to resources. This is also an insult to the people who have stuck by for years, only to be told they now need to insert more cash to further enjoy the game.
- The game is buggier than ever before. The renowned Blizzard polish is no longer present as they try to rush out as much content as possible, regardless of the outcome. It is incredibly rare to play a match without having at least one death or missed kill be attributed to a bug. 

Overwatch will always be special to me which is why it‚Äôs so heartbreaking to see it suffer through greed and mismanagement. You might enjoy the game but it‚Äôs no secret that the good days of Overwatch are long gone.

Too all the new players 

I played the original game 1600+ hours and it was so hard to quit. They then abandoned the game and suddenly released OW2. Played it and hated it. I sold my accounts and walked away with a massive profit. It gave me a reason to quit

Fast forward I made a new account just to check out since they allowed prepaid numbers. The game is utter rubbish now. No progression, you can't be a collector unless you wanna pay for overpriced cosmetics. They replaced a somewhat good rank system with garbage where you will match up with a range of ranks. Just so they can say the game have low queue times and hide the fact that the game is lacking players

My advice is just play a game or two. You will enjoy few games then you will realise that this is massive pile of S H I T. If you're adventurous, play comp to test your insanity. Also you'll need to play a ridiculous amount of matches to unlock heros. Good Luck LUL

Been a long time Overwatch 1 player with over 1k hours of playtime. Was a masters Tank main and had to watch the game slowly turn into the monstrosity it is now.

Do yourself a favour and stay away from it. Can't believe we would all miss the lootboxes this much since they found a method that was even less consumer-friendly to replace them with.

I'm a day one player, they ruined the game by adding role lock ranked and removing free role ranked. Now they added the free role ranked back but kept the role locked one too. You need to win 5 games to get the rank for each role or lose 60 games in total. The players are still one trick trash and can't switch when the enemy team counters our legends. There are also too many legends to chose from and some legends are overpowered in specific maps that you can't chose to not play. You are still forced to play a map that you don't like and where the enemy Lucio can boop you off the map constantly or Genji  one click delete your whole team. And of course now you have locked legends that are broken and after OW1 died the coins you had for legendarily skins are now useless for any new skin because they made them "Legacy" Coins that are completely useless as you need the new coins to buy any new skins. If you buy the battle pass you will not get the coins back like in Apex Legends so you're forced to buy a new battle pass each season. Oh and fuck blizzard they are completely not listening to their player base and ruining the game further. 

TLDR: Nothing changed from the dead game that is Overwatch 1, they just changed it from 6v6 to 5v5 because the Q times were over 30 minutes now it's 25 minutes, and they added the battle pass that you need to buy each season.
What a cool game, I sure hope its managed by a company that listens to its fandom and holds promises

Blizzard announced a PvE Campaign in 2019 but for some reason named it Overwatch 2 and "worked" so hard on it that they barely released anything for the actual game. 

Then in 2022 they profited off the hype to finally release OW2 - except it's not actually OW2 but just a glorified transition to an f2p model while also pissing over everyone who played before the release all under the promise of a "PvE Campaign" with actual content, replayability, skill trees etc.

Months later they announce the PvE was cancelled since the release of "OW2".

Then after the outrage they finally announce .... 3 PvE missions. That also cost 15$. For only 2 hours of shitty OW1 PvE-type of missions.

Blizzard deserves nothing
So many hours wasted in Overwatch 1, just to see Overwatch 2 crash and burn because ActiBlizz are greedy developers/publishers who made a worse battle pass than Halo infinite.
